channel.title: BBC News - World

item.title: Afghanistan: Taliban leaders in bust-up at presidential palace, sources say
item.description: Taliban officials say the group's co-founder left Kabul after an argument over the interim government.

item.title: Haiti PM Ariel Henry banned from leaving country amid murder inquiry
item.description: Charges are sought against Ariel Henry over alleged links with a suspect in the president's killing.

item.title: Faroe Islands: Anger over killing of 1,400 dolphins in one day
item.description: Hunting is under scrutiny after more than 1,400 dolphins were killed in one day - a reported record.

item.title: California ski resort changes offensive Native American name
item.description: The California resort's old name contained a slur offensive to Native American women.

item.title: Spain targets energy firms as European bills surge
item.description: Bills are spiralling in several countries and Spain agrees emergency measures to help consumers.

item.title: Dramatic body camera video shows Wichita fire rescue
item.description: Body camera video shows firefighters rushing into a burning flat complex to save trapped residents.

item.title: Boeing says air travel to return to pre-pandemic levels by 2024
item.description: Plane maker expects global aviation to take another two and a half years to recover.

item.title: Comedian Norm MacDonald dead at 61 from cancer
item.description: The Canadian comic was best known for presenting a news parody on Saturday Night Live in the 1990s.

item.title: Fashion house in backlash over 'racist' $1,190 sweatpants
item.description: Critics say the $1,190 pants, which come with a built-in pair of boxer shorts, rip off US hip hop culture.

item.title: Asteroid that wiped out dinosaurs shaped fortunes of snakes
item.description: Snakes owe their success in part to the asteroid impact that killed off the dinosaurs 66 million years ago.

item.title: Tropical storm Nicholas brings heavy rain to Texas and Louisiana
item.description: Meteorologists warn of life-threatening flooding, power outages and storm surges.

item.title: R. Kelly abused Aaliyah when she was 13 or 14, court hears
item.description: One of R. Kelly’s former backing dancers testifies at the star's sex trafficking trial in New York.

item.title: Apple iPhone 13 brings portrait mode for video
item.description: The portrait-mode style video setting can pull focus on its subjects automatically.

item.title: California recall election: Fact-checking Governor Newsom and his challengers
item.description: BBC News looks at some of the claims made by Governor Newsom and his challengers on the campaign trail.

item.title: What's gone wrong with the 'War on Terror' in Africa?
item.description: Twenty years after the US 'War on Terror' began, Islamist movements have spread across Africa.

item.title: Covid: Which countries are vaccinating children and why?
item.description: Millions of children around the world are being offered a Covid vaccine.

item.title: Met Gala: 13 of the most eye-catching looks
item.description: Jennifer Lopez, Simone Biles, Dan Levy, Ella Emhoff and Tommy Hilfiger were all on the red carpet.

item.title: Russia election: Opposition crushed ahead of managed polls
item.description: Exiled or disqualified, opposition voices warn of a government stitch-up in this week’s elections.

item.title: German election: Hunger strikers want greater action on climate change
item.description: Six young people say they won't end their hunger strike until the leading candidates meet them.

item.title: Why even giant ships can't solve the shipping crisis
item.description: A shortage of vessels is hampering global trade and may lead to empty shelves before Christmas.

item.title: World War Two: The forgotten Indian soldiers of Dunkirk
item.description: Some 300 Indian soldiers were evacuated from the coast of France during a pivotal moment in World War Two.

item.title: Amazon's Cape Town base: The battle to save South African culture
item.description: Some indigenous groups say the planned office in Cape Town is on culturally important land.

item.title: Met Gala 2021: Which celeb shone brightest on the red carpet?
item.description: After skipping last year because of coronavirus, celebrities went all out in the fashion stakes.

item.title: Life at 50C: The toxic gas flares fuelling Nigeria's climate change
item.description: Joy and her family are among 2m Nigerians living within 4km of a gas flare in Nigeria's oil-rich south.

item.title: Megapod of feeding humpback whales in Australia 'so special'
item.description: More than 100 humpback whales have been filmed feeding off Australia's New South Wales coast.

item.title: The Taliban are back – will al-Qaeda follow?
item.description: Where is al-Qaeda 20 years after the 9/11 attacks - and could it re-emerge as a terror threat?

item.title: China's Covid-driven surfing boom
item.description: Coronavirus restrictions limiting foreign travel lead to a boom in people riding the waves in China.
